title: Fact-Checking the $750 Shein Gift Card Promos

steps.title: Technically, but you usually have to spend your own money first.
steps.content: Technically, but you usually have to spend your own money first. If you’re familiar with the $750 Shein gift card offer, you’ve likely stumbled upon the Flash Rewards website. This site doesn’t actually give out money—rather, they facilitate the payout by partnering with lots of different third-party brand deals, which often require upfront payments on your end. [1] X Research source To qualify for the Shein credit, you need to complete a certain amount of deals on the website. A lot of the time, those deals require you to pay your own money—jump to the next section for more detail on what those deals might look like. [2] X Research source The Flash Rewards terms of service often require you to give the company permission to pass along your data to third-party companies that they partner with. By agreeing to these terms, you may end up bombarded with unwanted spam texts, calls, and emails. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Complete a short survey provided by Flash Rewards.
steps.content: Complete a short survey provided by Flash Rewards. Flash Rewards typically asks new customers to answer a 3-question survey related to the gift card that they’re interested in. [4] X Research source In the case of a Shein gift card, expect to be asked questions like: Do you shop with Shein? (Yes/No) How do you plan to use your $750 towards Shein? (Keep it/Give to a friend) About how many times do you go shopping per week? (< 3/3-7/7-10/10+)

steps.title: Provide your email.
steps.content: Provide your email. Enter the email that you’d like to receive your rewards with. [5] X Research source Shein may ask you for other information further down the line as well (in terms of reward distribution), like your address and phone number. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Agree to their terms and conditions.
steps.content: Agree to their terms and conditions. Before you can continue, you’ll likely need to agree to a special set of terms and conditions that allow Flash Rewards to give your data to their partners. Agreeing to this T&C may cause you to get spam messages/offers from different companies, which can be really frustrating to deal with. Unfortunately, agreeing to this T&C is typically non-negotiable, so you’ll have to weigh the pros and cons of agreeing to it for yourself. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Complete the required number of deals to qualify for the reward.
steps.content: Complete the required number of deals to qualify for the reward. Flash Rewards provides you with different “levels” of offers to complete; the higher the reward you’re angling for, the more higher-tier deals you’ll have to participate in. These deals often require you to either pay a small amount of money and/or sign up for a subscription service, which can trap you into further long-term payments if you don’t remember to cancel. [8] X Research source Users have reported some Flash Rewards deals being less than $10 per deal, or even being free of charge. However, even cheap deals can start to add up over time, and the “free” deals may require you to sign up for an expensive subscription service that will cost you money later (if you don't remember to cancel it). Other deals may also involve a long waiting period before they’re considered “complete” (like 60 days). Deals may include buying lottery tickets, signing up for betting services, signing up for streaming services (like Disney+), and so on. Other deals may require you to sign up for subscription services that come with a free product (e.g., getting a free snack box for signing up for a subscription snack service). Keep in mind that you have to complete the requirements of your deals within a fairly short time period (as specified by the terms and conditions). For instance, you can’t complete a deal, wait two months, and then complete more deals toward your $750 Shein credit. While Flash Rewards doesn’t appear to have any advanced security risks, their data distribution policy leaves a lot to be desired. Even if it’s not genuine spam (emails/texts promoting scams/malware), receiving huge volumes of marketing correspondence can feel very spam-like and overwhelming.

steps.title: Follow the provided instructions to claim your Shein credit.
steps.content: Follow the provided instructions to claim your Shein credit. The site will walk you through what you need to do in order to claim your rewards. At this time, the site will need a couple of days to confirm your identity and make sure you’ve completed the required number of rewards. [9] X Research source According to their website, customers who successfully received credit were able to get it in less than 2 weeks after first signing up on Flash Rewards. So, is Flash Rewards legit? Yes, but their reward system comes with strings attached. [10] X Research source Users on Trust Pilot give Flash Rewards 4 out of 5 stars on average, with the majority of reviews being 5-star, 4-star, or 1-star. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Avoid any email links that promise immediate Shein credit.
steps.content: Avoid any email links that promise immediate Shein credit. Phishing scams (schemes where scammers try to “fish” for your information) can involve a variety of different attention-grabbing ruses, including announcements that you’ve won a large sum of money. These emails often require you to click on a link to continue, which is how you get caught in the scam . [12] X Trustworthy Source Federal Trade Commission Website with up-to-date information for consumers from the Federal Trade Commisson Go to source You know the saying—if it’s too good to be true, it probably is. Flash Rewards is excluded from this warning, as their business model makes customers put in a lot of time and work for their Shein credit.

steps.title: Install anti-virus software to protect your computer and avoid malware.
steps.content: Install anti-virus software to protect your computer and avoid malware . Online scams often involve malware getting installed on your computer. [13] X Trustworthy Source Federal Trade Commission Website with up-to-date information for consumers from the Federal Trade Commisson Go to source Free programs like Avast One Essential , Bitdefender Antivirus Free , and AVG AntiVirus Free are all great to consider if you’re on a budget, while software like Bitdefender Antivirus Plus , G Data Antivirus , and Malwarebytes Premium are great to consider if you’re willing to spend a little money. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Never give out payment info in exchange for a gift card.
steps.content: Never give out payment info in exchange for a gift card. No reputable company will ask you to send over any sensitive financial information, like your bank account number or credit card number. There’s no such thing as a free lunch—and that applies to “free” gift card offers as well. [15] X Trustworthy Source Federal Trade Commission Website with up-to-date information for consumers from the Federal Trade Commisson Go to source The same logic applies to any sort of sensitive information, like your SSN. Real, legitimate companies will never ask for this type of information (aside from maybe a government agency or bank), and you should only give this info out to people or entities that you trust completely.

steps.title: Never feel pressured to engage with a Shein gift card deal right away.
steps.content: Never feel pressured to engage with a Shein gift card deal right away. Legitimate offers will have an established end date for their promotional offer and don’t require you to make a decision in a very short amount of time. If an offer is severely playing on your FOMO, you’re better off walking away. [16] X Trustworthy Source Federal Trade Commission Website with up-to-date information for consumers from the Federal Trade Commisson Go to source

steps.title: Report any phishing texts or emails you receive.
steps.content: Report any phishing texts or emails you receive. In America, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) encourages the recipients of phishing correspondence to report the message through official channels, depending on where they received it. [17] X Trustworthy Source Federal Trade Commission Website with up-to-date information for consumers from the Federal Trade Commisson Go to source If you received a phishing text: Use the “forward” function in your texts and send and report it to 7726 If you received a phishing email: Forward the spam correspondence to reportphishing@apwg.org For any type of phishing message: Submit a report on the FTC’s fraud reporting site

steps.title: Head to IdentifyTheft.gov and take further action there.
steps.content: Head to IdentifyTheft.gov and take further action there. Giving away sensitive information can definitely put you at risk for identity theft—but you can lower your risk as much as possible by reporting the breach as soon as possible. Head to the IdentityTheft website and follow the provided instructions to move forward with your case. [18] X Trustworthy Source Federal Trade Commission Website with up-to-date information for consumers from the Federal Trade Commisson Go to source

steps.title: RetailMeNot
steps.content: RetailMeNot RetailMeNot is a reputable source for a variety of different retailer coupon codes, including Shein. Certain deals may come with specific conditions (e.g., being a new customer, spending a certain amount of money), so keep that in mind before you apply any codes to your upcoming Shein order.

steps.title: Shein’s website
steps.content: Shein’s website Shein often has a variety of deals going on, especially if you’re a first-time shopper on the site. If you sign in upon visiting the site, you may also qualify for special coupons.

steps.title: While it’s possible to get a gift card, it’s likely not worth the effort.
steps.content: While it’s possible to get a gift card, it’s likely not worth the effort. With their numerous brand deals, it’s very possible that Flash Rewards can pay out for a $750 Shein gift card. However, the amount of deals you have to complete requires to you spend your own money as well as sign off some of your own personal data for distribution. For some, this trade-off may be worth it; for many others, it probably isn’t. [19] X Research source Even if you complete all the required deals needed to cash out, the deal will no longer be worth $750.

steps.title: Avoid offers that demand immediate payment or sensitive information.
steps.content: Avoid offers that demand immediate payment or sensitive information. Any reputable business or offer will never require instantaneous payment or incredibly sensitive information in exchange. If an “offer” ever asks you to provide your bank account info, SSN, or any other personal info, report it to the FTC on their website . [20] X Trustworthy Source Federal Trade Commission Website with up-to-date information for consumers from the Federal Trade Commisson Go to source
